notesStmt.note: Several pages stained. Folio 48 mutilated. Signs of water damage at the end.

In the flyleaves at the end, three paper fragments have been added. The first contains a fragment of Judeo-Arabic letter (12th century?); the other two fragments contain Hebrew fragments with superlinear punctuation.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Jeremiah and Ezekiel with Targum Onḳelos, provided with superlinear punctuation.

collation.p: Originally 18 quires: i8, ii-xi10, xii-xiii8, xiv-xvii10, xviii5. Quires signed with Hebrew letters on the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite square script; Biblical text and Targum with simple Babylonian (superlinear) punctuation, in alternate verses.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 24 November 1877 (folio [172v]).
